title: Gray Matters: Multi-domain Lifestyle Behavioral Alzheimer's Disease Prevention Randomized Controlled Trial
description_brief: This is a randomized controlled trial to develop and test the efficacy of a multi-domain lifestyle behavioral intervention designed to promote healthier lifestyle behaviors linked to lower Alzheimer's disease risk among persons aged 40 to 64 years.
description_detailed: This is a randomized controlled trial to develop and test the efficacy of a multi-domain lifestyle behavioral intervention designed to promote healthier lifestyle behaviors linked to lower Alzheimer's disease risk among persons aged 40 to 64 years. Participants are randomized to treatment or control condition. The intervention, spanning a six month period, is an evidence-based health education program.
explanation_target: Reason: The Gray Matters trial is a randomized, multi-domain lifestyle behavioral intervention (targeting physical activity, food choices, social engagement, cognitive stimulation, sleep quality, and stress management) aimed at reducing future Alzheimer’s disease risk in middle-aged adults (ages ~40–64). This is a behavioral/preventive intervention, not a pharmacologic agent or biologic, so it does not fit the four drug-target categories. citeturn0search7turn0search0

Act: Key extracted details — Trial name: "Gray Matters: Multi-domain Lifestyle Behavioral Alzheimer's Disease Prevention Randomized Controlled Trial"; design: proof-of-concept RCT (treatment n≈104, control n≈42; total ≈146); population: ages 40–64; intervention components: bespoke Gray Matters smartphone app, activity monitor, educational materials, booster events and health-coach contact; outcomes include biomarkers, BMI, cognitive testing, and surveys. No drug or placebo is used or described. Trial registration referenced: NCT02290912. citeturn0search7turn0search2turn0search4

Reflect: Classification check — by the provided definitions, this is neither a disease-targeted biologic nor small molecule, nor a cognitive-enhancer drug, nor an intervention aimed primarily at neuropsychiatric symptom reduction. It is a behavioral lifestyle prevention trial; therefore the correct category is 'N/A'. Supporting sources (selected search results): 1) PMC full article describing design and progress of Gray Matters (randomized trial, domains targeted, age range). citeturn0search7 2) PubMed/clinical summary including trial registration (NCT02290912) and description of app-based intervention. citeturn0search2 3) PubMed article on motivation and behavior outcomes from Gray Matters (app, activity tracker, diet and activity effects). citeturn0search4
